RenderSurrogate
public class XPathSurrogate
extends AbstractRenderSurrogate
implements RenderSurrogate

Implements a flexible Rendering surrogate based on a proprietary XPath syntax

Author:
Andrew

readRaw

public boolean readRaw(javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamReader reader,
                       SIFVersion version,
                       SIFElement parent,
                       SIFFormatter formatter)
                throws ADKParsingException
Description copied from interface: RenderSurrogate
Called by the parser when it is on an element it cannot parse. Multiple RenderSurrogates may be called during a failed parse operation. If the RenderSurrogate successfully parses the XML, it returns true

Specified by:
readRaw in interface RenderSurrogate
Parameters:
reader - An XmlStreamReader that is positioned on the current node
version - The SIFVersion being parsed
parent - The SIFElement that is the parent of this field
formatter - The SIFFormatter to use for parsing xsd datatypes
Returns:
True if the surrogates successfully parses the node. False if the node is not recognize by the surrogate.
Throws:
ADKParsingException

createNodePointer

public org.apache.commons.jxpath.ri.model.NodePointer createNodePointer(org.apache.commons.jxpath.ri.model.NodePointer parent,
                                                                        Element sourceElement,
                                                                        SIFVersion version)
Creates a NodePointer that "wraps" the specified ADK 2.0 element, but appears to JXPath as if it uses the SIF 1.5 path. XPathSurrogates always represent a surrogate around an ADK 2.0 Simple Field

Specified by:
createNodePointer in interface RenderSurrogate
sourceElement - The Element to create a node pointer for
version - The SIFVersion in effect
Returns:
A NodePointer representing the current element
